infos.value: King Khury had...terms? For Glaciela?
Surely you don't mean that rejecting those terms would cost her the crown?
That is precisely what I mean.
What exactly were those terms...?
All of Lady Glaciela's relatives were to be executed.
Wh-what did you—!?
Why would King Khury force such cruel terms upon his daughter...?
It really is rather simple.
Lady Glaciela's mother was not of royal birth, nor was she noble of blood.
All...for the sake of a bloodline? Why would that even be relevant!?
But it is. The royal subjects would likely not be very understanding.
For them to be made to serve a queen whose blood is mixed with that of a lowborn...
Those royal subjects would consider it incredibly humiliating. One need not think hard on the matter to understand.
In other words, King Khury set those terms to seal away the secret of Lady Glaciela's birth?
For that reason alone...he ordered the slaughter of her mother and siblings!?
What a fool!
Naturally, Lady Glaciela refused to go along with such unfair terms.
Causing her relationship with King Khury to sour?
Would that it were a mere souring...
Lady Glaciela took command of her personal battalion, «Spirare», and disappeared from the royal palace.
You jest...
Wezette will likely be split in two before long.
Do you mean there will be a civil war!?
King Khury has made his decision.
He believed that your engagement to Glaciela would spur you—and all of Leonis—to join her side.
So that's why he ordered you to kill us.
That is not the only reason.
If Wezette were to gain control of the ring you bear, Lord Mont...
Then our «Equito» would become a mighty army to rival even «Solidus», the pride of Hourne.
With such an army, King Khury would no longer have to bend the knee to Sadali...
Precisely, Lord Mont.
That explains the hasty alliance with Fennes.
The situation is far more complicated than I had foreseen.
Bearing all this in mind, Lord Mont...would you still be escorted to Wezette Castle?
...Yes.
Our options have not grown, so what other choice do we have?
